thread.title: Breezy Point resort on Lake Superior gets new owner
thread.title_full: Breezy Point resort on Lake Superior gets new owner

author: Cody Nelson
title: Breezy Point resort on Lake Superior gets new owner
text:
Breezy Point resort on Lake Superior gets new owner Jul 24, 2015, 1:06pm CDT Industries & Tags Cody Nelson Staff reporter Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Cody Nelson Staff reporter Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Home of the Day Odyssey Resorts The resort sits off Highway 61 on Lake Superior's north shore. Odyssey Resorts on Friday said it purchased Breezy Point Resort, a 12-cabin operation just south of Two Harbors on the north shore of Lake Superior. The deal's terms weren't disclosed. The resort's cabins are available for rent or fractional ownership starting at $69,000. "Our vision for Breezy Point is to retain all of the simple charm enjoyed by generations of renters, while offering an affordable price of entry for ownership,” Odyssey Resorts CEO Bob Ryan said in a news release. “We couldn’t be more pleased to add the gem that is Breezy Point Resort on Lake Superior to our collection.” The deal gives Odyssey its seventh resort in Minnesota. It also owns Caribou Highlands in Lutsen and Trapper's Landing on Leech Lake.
